_comment: Promethean Kanban Configuration - Human & Agent Documentation
_description: This config drives the kanban board generation from task files. The board is a finite state machine (FSM) with states = columns. See docs/agile/process.md for the complete FSM specification and transition rules.
_usage: Never edit board files directly. Tasks drive board generation. Use 'pnpm kanban regenerate' to rebuild board from tasks.
_wip_note: WIP limits are enforced by transitions - a move to a column fails if that column's WIP cap is full.

_status_descriptions.icebox: üßä Ice Box - Deferred/archived tasks, not actively being worked on (brainstorm lane)
_status_descriptions.incoming: üí≠ Incoming - New tasks enter here (initial state) (brainstorm lane)
_status_descriptions.accepted: ‚úÖ Accepted - Triage complete, ready for breakdown analysis (planning lane)
_status_descriptions.breakdown: üß© Breakdown - Task being broken into small, testable slices with Fibonacci estimates (planning lane)
_status_descriptions.blocked: üöß Blocked - Explicit dependency on another task (bidirectional links required) (planning lane)
_status_descriptions.ready: üõ† Ready - Scoped, estimated (‚â§5), ready for execution queue (execution lane)
_status_descriptions.todo: üü¢ To Do - Prioritized in execution queue, ready to pull (execution lane)
_status_descriptions.in_progress: üü° In Progress - Actively being worked on (WIP limited) (execution lane)
_status_descriptions.review: üîç In Review - Coherent, reviewable change exists (execution lane)
_status_descriptions.document: üìö Document - Recording evidence and summaries (execution lane)
_status_descriptions.rejected: ‚ùå Rejected - Non-viable, may be moved to Ice Box (abandoned lane)

_wip_rationale: Updated for multi-agent development environment: 1 human + 6-18 AI agents. Review limit reflects human bandwidth for reviewing AI work. In-progress limit accommodates parallel AI agent work while maintaining flow constraints. See docs/agile/process.md 'Fluid Kanban Rule Evolution' section.

rules.description: Break down task or return for more info
Complete breakdown, return for clarification, or block
Queue task or return for re-estimation
Submit for review, pause, or return for planning
Approve for documentation, request changes, or queue for rework
Complete documentation or return for additional review

task-triaged?.description: Task has been triaged and accepted

task-ready-for-breakdown?.description: Task is properly scoped for breakdown analysis

task-properly-broken-down?.description: Task is broken down into small, testable slices

dependencies-resolved?.description: All blocking dependencies have been resolved

globalRules.name: wip-limits
globalRules.description: Enforce WIP limits for all columns

globalRules.name: task-existence
globalRules.description: Task must exist in source column

_transition_rules_note: See docs/agile/process.md for complete FSM transition rules. Key rules: Incoming‚ÜíAccepted‚ÜíBreakdown‚ÜíReady‚ÜíTodo‚ÜíIn Progress‚ÜíReview‚ÜíDocument‚ÜíDone. Tasks with score >5 must cycle back through Breakdown until slice is small enough (‚â§5).
